If records are changed after initial recording/entry, are changes clearly legible (errors marked through and initialled); recorded in ink, not pencil? | Record reviewed: 4.7F9 MDB Automatic Spout Inserter: Weekly verifications completed for December 4, 11 & 18, 2023. Clear and legible. | 3 |  |  |  |  | |  |  |
| Preventative Maintenance schedule | Is there a documented maintenance program covering all production and plant equipment? Are records available? | The facility has an effective maintenance program in place (Doc Ref 4.7 Rev 12 dated 28 April 2022) to prevent contamination and minimize the risk of breakdowns. A comprehensive maintenance plan is established, which includes information like the item, frequency of maintenance, and verification method. The maintenance schedule for various machines is as follows: DMF & LYS Stand Up Pouch Making Machine 4.7F4 Rev 9 dated 27 September 2021, AMJ Flat Pouch Making Machine 4.7F6 Rev 6 dated 27 September 2021, MDB Spout Inserter Machine 4.7F8 dated 27 September 2021, FES Slitting Machine 4.7F13 Rev 0 dated 31 May 2022. The maintenance work for the following machines has been completed and verified:  - 4.7F7 AMJ Maintenance Flat Pouch Machine: Dec 2024  - 4.7F9 MDB Automatic Spout Inserter: Weekly verifications completed for December 4, 11 & 18, 2023  - 4.7F14 FES Slitting Machine (Weekly): Verification completed on November 6, 14, 20 and 27, 2023  - 4.7F12 LYS Stand Up Pouch Machine (Monthly): Completed and verified, including maintenance work on compressor with jobcard number 23492 (Old) & 2113 (New). | 0 |  |  |  |  | |  |  |
| Are maintenance logs maintained for all off-line testing equipment? Do these include: any adjustments and the re-calibration date of any interventions. | In order to ensure that machines operate smoothly, we conduct pre-startup checks for each machine and record the results on the Production Log sheets. These checks include inspections of blades, trim blades, and the web divider bar. Once the machines are used, all tools and maintenance equipment are properly cleared and stored. We have suitable tool holders conveniently located near the delivery end of each machine for easier access. Records reviewed for: | 3 |  |  |  |  | |  |  |
| Inspection of equipment during production | Is the condition of the equipment that is critical to product safety, legality and quality inspected at predetermined intervals? Inspection results documented and appropriate action taken? | Condition monitoring is performed at regular intervals, which are predetermined either monthly or weekly. During the review, the following records were examined:  - 4.7F7 AMJ Maintenance Flat Pouch Machine: Completed and verified in Dec 2024.  - 4.7F9 MDB Automatic Spout Inserter: Weekly verifications completed on December 4th, 11th, and 18th, 2023.  - 4.7F14 FES Slitting Machine (Weekly): Verification completed on November 6th, 14th, 20th, and 27th, 2023.  - 4.7F12 LYS Stand Up Pouch Machine (Monthly): Completed and verified, including maintenance work on the compressor with job card numbers 23492 (Old) and 2113 (New).  As of 30th January 2024, some job cards are still open. With discussion it was confirmed that some of these actions have been taken. The details are as follows:  AMJ Book:  - 10th November 2023 (01003): Chiller unit in AMJ is broken.  - 28th September 2023 (01010): Element wire is broken and there are no fuses.  DMF Book:  - 9th November 2023 (00958): Air shaft is broken and is not holding air.  LYS Book:  - 24th October 2023 (01077): The blade is not cutting at all. | 0 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Post Maintenance cleaning | Is there a documented procedure detailing the release of equipment to production after maintenance is performed? Are records of clearance on file | Reviewed the records of maintenance job cards that include the following details:  11.12.23 – 00998 – The gusset jaw element had a broken conductor which caused the heat to drop. Repair: replaced the broken lug.  29.1.2024 – 01087 – The LCD screen was experiencing fading and intermittent on/off issues. Repair: reconnected it to the board, ensuring that it was held firmly.  30.11.2024 – 01016 – The chiller was not cooling water. Repair: cleaned out the air vents and changed the water.  11.10.2023 – 00993 – The switch on the trim unit was broken. Repair: replaced the switch and completed hygiene clearance. | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Temporary repairs | Are temporary repairs used only in emergencies and when product is not at risk? Is there a specified timeframe for use? Is the process documented? | The procedure and risk assessment have taken into account temporary repairs. |  |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Tools and other maintenance equipment | Are tools and other maintenance equipment cleared away after use and appropriately stored?? | Hygiene clearance recorded in 4.7F11. | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |

| Maintenance contractors | Are contractors involved in maintenances or repair monitored by a staff member? Is this staff member responsible for their activities? | Contractor on site was accompanied by member of staff. | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Only Food grade Materials eg lubricants used for maintenance work | Are Materials used for the equipment and plant maintenance and that pose a risk by direct or indirect contact with raw materials, intermediate and finished products, such as lubricating oil, food grade?  Allergen free? | As part of lubrication, the facility utilizes Foodlube Multipaste Spray (Rocol), Industria; Cleaner Rapid Dry Spray, Foodlube Protect spray; all of which are NSF registered and listed on the Master List of Chemicals (5.8F3). | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Stored away in a separate secured area, and clearly labelled? | Storage pose no risk. | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
| Lubrication type and requirements defined on the master list of chemicals? | Masterlist of chemicals on file, 5.8F3. | 3 |  |  |  | |  |  |  |
